title: Effects of TNF? on cell viability, proliferation and apoptosis of glioma cells U251.
abstract: To analyse the relationship between the expression of TNF? and the characteristics of glioma cell line U251.U251 cell line was transfected with overexpressed TNF? or depleted TNF? constructs. The cell viability, proliferation and apoptosis were determined with MTT assay and flow cytometry analysis. The expressions of TNF?, caspase or microRNA (miR) were detected by Western blot analysis or real-time PCR (RT-PCR). The activity of caspase3 was examined by the absorbance of p-nitroaniline (pNA) production.Overexpression of TNF? could decrease cell viability, suppress cell proliferation and promote cell apoptosis, whereas knockdown of TNF? displayed the opposite effects. In addition, the effects of TNF? on the expression of caspase3, miR-9-3p, miR-9-5p, miR-17-3p, miR-17-5p, miR-31-3p and miR-31-5p were also probed. Overexpression of TNF? could raise the expression of caspase3 and miR-9 and knockdown of TNF? had an opposite effect. Our results also showed the overexpression of miR-9 could increase the expression of caspase3, while the inhibition of miR-9 had the opposite effect.These results suggested that TNF? might be involved in the attenuation of growth, proliferation and promotion of apoptosis in U-251 cells by regulating the expression of miR-9 and caspase3 and that miR-17 and miR- 31 perhaps were not correlated with the apoptosis of U251 cells or not acted as important factors in mediating the apoptosis of U251 cells induced by TNF?. Furthermore, the caspase3 could be regulated by miR-9 in an indirect way.
